content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Copper Ore Mining and Processing Facility at Position (-23.0, -68.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (-23.0, -68.0) connected to a transport belt network and a wooden chest at position (-23.5, -69.5) for copper ore collection.
- Transport belts connecting the mining drill to the wooden chest and other parts of the facility.

### Iron Plate Production Facility
Consists of the following entities:
- Stone Furnace at position (-20.0, -70.0) with a full output of iron plates.
- Stone Furnace at position (-18.0, -70.0) with no ingredients to smelt.
- Stone Furnace at position (-19.0, -65.0) with no ingredients to smelt.
- Stone Furnace at position (-21.0, -62.0) with no ingredients to smelt.
- Transport belts and burner inserters facilitating the movement of iron ore and plates between furnaces and chests.

### Iron Ore Mining Facility at Position (-14.0, -53.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (-14.0, -53.0) currently out of fuel.
- Transport belts connecting the mining drill to a wooden chest at position (-12.5, -54.5) for iron ore collection.
- Burner inserter at position (-13.5, -54.5) waiting for source items.

### Miscellaneous Storage and Processing
- Wooden chests at various positions for storage of coal, iron ore, iron plates, and other resources.
- Burner inserters and transport belts facilitating the movement of resources between chests and other entities.

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when using extracting but being too far
- Make sure to move to the target entity where you want to extract from before extracting items.

### Errors when placing into a tile which is occupied by another entity
- Ensure you can place an entity to a tile before attempting placing.

### Errors due to furnaces having full output or no ingredients
- Regularly check the output of furnaces to ensure they are not full and can continue production.
- Ensure a steady supply of ingredients to furnaces to prevent them from running out and halting production.

### Errors due to mining drills running out of fuel
- Regularly refuel mining drills to prevent them from stopping operations due to lack of fuel.
